alert.note: Alert for Brown; Coleman (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 8:22PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Brown and northeastern Coleman Counties through 915 PM CDT... At 822 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Echo, or near Burkett, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Brownwood, Early, Santa Anna, Bangs, Blanket, Lake Brownwood Near Thrifty, Burkett, May, Cross Cut, Lake Brownwood, Byrds, Grosvenor, Lake Brownwood State Park, Echo, Owens and Thrifty. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
